name: Wireless Network Attacks
author: Network Testing Team
description: Leverage wireless networks to bypass wired NAC restrictions.

overview.purpose: Test wireless security and use wireless access points to bypass wired network access controls.
overview.scope: Wireless networks, access points, wireless authentication, and wireless-to-wired network bridging within the target environment.
prerequisites: WiFi adapter with monitor mode support
Proper authorization for wireless testing activities

triggers.name: wireless_network_present
triggers.description: Trigger when wireless networks are available for testing

equipment: WiFi adapter with monitor mode support

procedures.name: Wireless Network Attacks
procedures.description: Leverage wireless networks to bypass wired NAC restrictions.

risks.risk: Wireless attacks may be detected by wireless IDS
risks.mitigation: Use low-power attacks and avoid excessive deauthentication

risks.risk: Legal restrictions may apply to wireless testing
risks.mitigation: Ensure proper authorization for wireless testing activities

commands.description: Put wireless interface into monitor mode

findings.title: Wireless NAC Bypass
findings.description: Wireless networks provide alternative access paths that bypass wired network access controls, allowing unauthorized network access.
findings.recommendation: Implement consistent security policies across wired and wireless networks, deploy wireless intrusion detection systems, and ensure wireless networks have proper segmentation from critical resources.

cleanup.description: Stop wireless monitor mode and restore normal operation

troubleshooting.issue: Wireless interface won't enter monitor mode
troubleshooting.solution: Check driver support for monitor mode, verify interface is not in use by other processes, and try different wireless adapters.
Check antenna connections, verify wireless is enabled, move to different locations, and check for 5GHz networks.
